subject: Baseball
lead_paragraph: American pitchers scattered seven hits and Jayson Nix and Jason Jaramillo each had two runs batted in as the United States defeated Cuba, 6-3, to win the Baseball World Cup in Taipei, Taiwan. The United States took command in the second inning when Jaramillo singled in a run, and Yadel Carrillo walked two consecutive batters with the bases loaded. Jaramillo singled in his second run in the third, and in the next inning Nix homered to make it 5-0.
